channel.title: Management Scholar Search – Weekly Digest
channel.description: Research funding, CFPs, and conferences in management & international business.

item.title: Pre-announcement: Northern Ireland Election Study 2026 to 2031
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: General

This is a pre-announcement for the opportunity to run the Northern Ireland Election Study (NIES) between 2026 and 2036, and the funding for the 2027 devolved election and the 2029 UK general election in Northern Ireland. You must be based at a UK research organisation eligible f

item.title: Turing AI pioneer interdisciplinary fellowships (invite only)
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: Innovation/Tech

Apply for fellowship funding to build artificial intelligence (AI) capability. This funding opportunity is for established researchers from across UK Research and Innovation (UKRI)’s remit, without a background in core AI research, who want to build domain relevant AI capability

item.title: Growth Catalyst: investor partnerships round two
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: General

UK registered micro, small and medium-sized enterprises can apply for grant funding alongside private investment from selected investor partners.<br /><p><span style="padding: 2px 5px; margin: 10px 10px 10px 0; display: inline-block; background-color: #2E2D62; color: #FFF;">Innov

item.title: Research and partnership hubs for a healthy society (invite only)
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: General

Apply for funding to establish a large-scale multidisciplinary research hub drawing on expertise across the EPSRC and health research community to support people to live healthier lives and prevent ill health. You must be based at a UK research organisation eligible for EPSRC fu

item.title: Nucleus Public Engagement Awards 2026
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: Innovation/Tech

Apply for funding to engage the public with Science and Technology Facilities Council (STFC) supported science and/or raise engagement capacity in STFC communities. You must work for an organisation that: <ul> <li>is based in the UK</li> <li>has audited accounts</li> </ul> P

item.title: Creative Industries Clusters: round two: outline stage
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: General

Apply for funding to deliver a Creative Industries Cluster to address a challenge for the creative industries in a specific geography, sub-sector or both. Clusters should focus on regional economic growth through applied R&D. You must be based at a UK research organisation el

item.title: ADOPT Facilitator Support Grant: round six
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: General

Farming, growing or forestry businesses based in England can apply for a grant of £2,500, to engage an external project facilitator to support the development of a full ADOPT grant application.<br /><p><span style="padding: 2px 5px; margin: 10px 10px 10px 0; display: inline-block

item.title: Energy Catalyst round 11, mid stage
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: General

Organisations can apply for a share of up to £7 million across the three strands of the competition. This is for energy access in official development assistance eligible countries in sub-Saharan Africa, South Asia, the Indo Pacific region and Latin America.<br /><p><span style=

item.title: International Placement Scheme 2026
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: Innovation/Tech

Apply to undertake a placement at an international cultural institution. You must either be: <ul> <li>a PhD student funded by the Arts and Humanities Research Council (AHRC) or Economic and Social Research Council (ESRC)</li> <li>an early career researcher based at a UK resea

item.title: Commercialising Knowledge Assets Fund (CKAF) Spring
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: Innovation/Tech

UK registered government research organisations can apply for grants from £50,000 up to £250,000 to move viable public sector knowledge assets towards commercial readiness. This funding is provided by the Government Office for Technology Transfer (GOTT).<br /><p><span style="padd

item.title: Drive35 innovation fund: demonstrate 2
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: Innovation/Tech

UK registered organisations can apply for a share of up to £33 million for late stage demonstration research and development projects. Projects will support the UK’s transition to zero emission vehicles and a pathway to a net zero automotive industry.<br /><p><span style="padding

item.title: BBSRC Innovation to Commercialisation of University Research (ICURe) Explore 2026
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: Innovation/Tech

BBSRC ICURe Explore is a market exploration programme for bioscience researchers and technicians. BBSRC ICURe Explore is open to bioscience researchers in: <ul> <li>UK universities</li> <li>BBSRC-funded institutes</li> <li>BBSRC-approved public sector research enterprises<

item.title: DRIVE35 innovation fund: collaborate 2
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: Innovation/Tech

UK registered organisations can apply for a share of up to £33 million for late stage collaborative research and development projects. Your project will support the UK’s transition to zero emission vehicles and a pathway to a net zero automotive industry.<br /><p><span style="pa

item.title: Pre-announcement: Pushing the frontiers of environmental science 2026
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: General

item.title: UK-Ireland collaboration in the creative economy: research networking awards
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: General

Apply for funding to form creative economy focused networks between researchers and stakeholders in the UK and Ireland. Arts and Humanities Research Council (AHRC) will provide up to £35,000 full economic costs (FEC) and Research Ireland will provide up to €35,000 for the Irish

item.title: Early independence: clinician scientist fellowship
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: General

Apply for an early independence fellowship if your research focus is within Medical Research Council (MRC) remit. You must: <ul> <li>be a registered healthcare professional</li> <li>have a PhD or equivalent</li> <li>show evidence of career consolidation and productivity</l

item.title: Professional doctorate: clinical research training fellowship
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: General

Apply for funding to undertake a PhD. Your research can focus on any area of Medical Research Council (MRC)’s remit to improve human health. You must: <ul> <li>be a registered healthcare professional</li> <li>be at an appropriate point in your training to undertake a PhD</l

item.title: Capacity building: clinical research training fellowship
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: General

Apply for funding to reacquire research skills. Your research can focus on any area of Medical Research Council (MRC)’s remit to improve human health. You must: <ul> <li>be a registered healthcare professional</li> <li>be a PhD graduate working outside of research, usually

item.title: New 'Change!' projects use research to shape change
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: Sustainability

How can our society become sustainable? The Volkswagen Foundation is funding eight new research projects with a total of €14.4 million. They are approaching this question from different angles – together with partners from the field. Topics include among others smart technologies

item.title: Distributed Peer Review (DPR): Study Shows Potential for Faster and More Democratic Review
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: General

A new RoRI study on the use of distributed peer review (DPR) at the Volkswagen Foundation shows how the review process can speed up funding decisions and make them more democratic.

item.title: Live Webinar on Our Funding Portfolio
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: General

Twice a year - at the beginning of each semester in April and October - the Volkswagen Foundation offers a free, one-hour live webinar in English on the funding portfolio. The next webinar is scheduled for 9 April 2026.

item.title: Multiple Transformations and Current Crisis: Higher Education in the U.S. and Europe
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: General

Mitchell G. Ash (Vienna) spoke about the transformation of research and universities since the Second World War and the possible fundamental impact of the current US politics on global academia on September 11th, 2025 in Hanover. See his lecture here.

item.title: Can Universities Save Democracy?
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: conference   Topic: General

On 10 September 2025, experts gathered at Herrenhausen Palace to take part in a symposium on the topic of why authoritarian regimes routinely attack educational institutions, what this says about the value of these institutions to open societies, and how universities can return t

item.title: Research as a bridge: Lower Saxony celebrates partnership with Israel
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: Innovation/Tech

Sixty years ago, a unique scientific collaboration began between Germany and Israel. A ceremony at Herrenhausen Palace on 15 September celebrated this engine of innovation and mutual understanding –  as well as the 100th anniversary of two leading Israeli universities.

item.title: Research Meets Administration: Finding Practical Solutions Together
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: Innovation/Tech

Administration without queues – this could be the outcome of Prof. Dr. Anna Maria Oberländer's 'Change!' project. Her goal: people-centred digital administration.

item.title: Night Science: Ten Research Tandems Selected by Lottery
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: General

54 applications, ten funded tandems - and a lottery drum: with the Night Science funding programme, the Volkswagen Foundation is for the first time specifically supporting the creative beginnings of scientific projects.

item.title: Christina Roggatz: Science That Makes Waves
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: General

Marine scientist Dr Christina Roggatz from the University of Bremen is leading her own team for the first time – and through her work wants to arrive at a better understanding of climate change. Here she gives us an insight into her everyday life as leader of a junior research gr

item.title: New Bridge Professorships for Transatlantic Research
item.description:
Region: North America   Type: funding   Topic: General

With its new funding initiative "Transatlantic Bridge Professorships", the Foundation aims to strengthen connections between renowned scholars from the United States and research institutions in Germany. The programme focuses on key topics such as democracy, fundamental rights, a

item.title: Scoping Workshops
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: cfp   Topic: General

This is about the future of your research area: What is the current status? What prospects are there for further development - and how can they be realised? With the "Scoping Workshops" the foundation offers space for discussion and intensive exchange. Online Q&A (in German)

item.title: Coasts Under Pressure – New Strategies for Coastal Protection
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: Sustainability

Storm surges, rising sea levels, endangered coasts: as part of her Change! Fellowship, Dr Claudia Wolff from the University of Kiel is working with local stakeholders to find new ways of ensuring sustainable coastal protection on the Baltic Sea.

item.title: The Volkswagen Foundation at Falling Walls 2025
item.description:
Region: Europe   Type: funding   Topic: General

Register now for the free livestream: Falling Walls will take place in Berlin from 6 to 9 November 2025. Here is an overview of all live-streamed events in which the foundation is involved.
